intro: Teucrium polium var. scoparium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features aromatic, lance-shaped leaves that are typically gray-green in color, with a rough, fuzzy texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pale blue to violet, blooming in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its medicinal properties have been historically valued for their antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects.
